fields.description: We noticed that fields like Priority and Resolution have an abbreviated column heading such as Pr and Res which is great when trying to display lots of columns.  Can the custom fields functionality be enhanced to allow the ability to create an abbreviation and have the option to  use the abbreviation as the column heading? I did not see any similar tickets to this so I'm creating a new request.  If there is one already out there for this, please let me know and I will add a comment/vote on that one.
fields.summary: Custom fields - have the ability to have an abbreviation display in the column heading

fields.description:
Oh no, it's ASCII art! That's somewhat cool and possibly even useful for a beta release, but is a bad idea for a production enterprise product. Here's why:

1. It takes up unnecessary space in the log file, like having debugging turned on full.
2. It confuses customers when not viewed at full width - it really does look like line noise in an 80 char terminal.
3. Surely, a marketing slogan doesn't belong in a log file
4. It makes it look like no-one is leading the product from the helm. Why not add some flashing color to it too? A few pretty pictures of the developers, perhaps? 

Guys, if you're bored of just adding fixes, please do something both creative and useful.

~Matt
fields.summary: JIRA produces line noise when it starts up

fields.description:
Here are the following steps to reproduce this bug:
+First Part+
# Enabled the Time Tracking field and make sure that the Time Tracking field is not hidden
# Using a Default Issue Type Screen Scheme, inside the Screen that is associated with it, please remove 'Time Tracking' from that screen
# Create a new issue from any project (e.g: TST-1)
# In the Create Issue screen, you should not be able to see the *Original Estimate* field
# Once the issue is created, create a new sub-task (e.g: TST-2)
# Go back to the parest issue, TST-1, you should be able to see the normal sub-task quick create form where it has Summary, Issue Type, Assignee, and Original Estimate
# Using the sub-task quick create form, create another sub-task issue (TST-3) under TST-1 but this time add in any value to the 'Original Estimate' field (e.g: 1h)
# However, when you try to counter-check with the database:
{noformat}
select * from jiraissue where pkey='TST-3';
{noformat}
You will be able to see that there will be a *NULL* value in {{TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE}} column. 

+Second Part+
# Go back to the Default Issue Type Screen Scheme, inside the Screen that is associated with it, please add back the 'Time Tracking' into the screen
# Go back to the parent issue, TST-1 and using the sub-task quick create form, create another sub-task issue (TST-4) and add in any value to the 'Original Estimate' field (e.g:2h)
# Counter-checking with the database:
{noformat}
select * from jiraissue where pkey='TST-4';
{noformat}
You will be able to see that the value _7600_ is being stored inside {{TIMEORIGINALESTIMATE}} column. 

In conclusion, the sub-task quick create form does not synchronize with the screen configuration configured for the Create Issue screen. Nevertheless, JIRA database should be able to capture the value after being added inside the 'Original Estimate' field even though it is in sub-task quick create form.
fields.summary: Entering time in Original Estimate field in sub-task create form does not store inside the database

fields.description:
When trying to click to the star (meaning favorite) in dashboard management page, to take a dashboard out of my favorites : 

- with Firefox : seems to work but when I refresh the page, nothing was done (see attachment 1)

- with IE : error message "Error occurred communicating with the server. Please reload the page and try again"  (see attachment 2)

Same problem appears with filters.
fields.summary: Unable to un-favorite dashboard

fields.description:
Atlassian Connector for Eclipse uses SOAP, RSS and HTML sessions to handle requests for JIRA.

After introducing CAPTCHA on the server we don't know whether user provided wrong credentials or was blocked due too many failed login attemps.

SOAP doesn't tell anything else than "authentication failed". We use SOAP to validate credentials when setting up the server configuration.

Web/RSS sessions use POST to /secure/Dashboard.jsp. If login fails we could analyse response body and see if CAPTCHA was required. Unfortunately from what I see the login form is dynamically created and I'm unable to tell whether there was any CAPTCHA. ACE doesn't run JavaScript and doesn't render the page so I don't have the login form.

I need some solution for this. Otherwise we won't be able to tell user CAPTCHA is required. And that will totally suck :-/
fields.summary: Unable to tell when CAPTCHA is required using remote API

fields.description:
I use quick search quite a bit, sometimes I just want some simple change to the query I just did (and not use JQL).

It'd be nice if I had just done a quick search (ie whenever you display that yellow box saying you've just ran a quick search), the Quick search box itself keeps whatever query I just typed in (exactly as it was)
fields.summary: Quick search box should keep last quick searched item

fields.description:
Even considering for the flexibility of JIRA / people use in a different way blah blah, one of the key items on the page is the Status.

Consider:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100526-jm52hpga9jq4m6tk7h37nr278k.png!

the thing that immediately jumps up (helps to defocus the eyes a bit) is the red bold security level. I've had to do quite of bit of scanning around the middle of the screen to find the status.

We should emphasise the status like:

!http://img.skitch.com/20100526-jexj9q4e21d54aqhd6tpi1g8uy.png!

this way the status stands out immediately.

(NB you _could_ also argue that the Security Level could just be red and not bold or just have the lock icon, but it's easy enough to scan through two things rather than 4)
fields.summary: Status should be highlighted on the page

fields.description:
As of the 4.0 release list of the plugins listed in the Plugins section of System Info has dramatically increased.

In Support often we need to go through the list of the installed plugin while troubleshooting problems reported by customers. 

Dividing the list into two part where we would separate the upgraded plugins and 3th party one from the bundled plugins would greatly benefit Support.

Currently, we need to go through over 60 bundled plugins (!) and look for any plugin that doesn't *seem* to be provided by default in JIRA.
fields.summary: System Info should display custom and updated plugins separately from the bundled plugins
Make the Workflow plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Wiki Renderer Macros plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Web Resources plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the User Format plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Top Navigation Bar plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Reports plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Renderer plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Project Roles Actor plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Project Panels plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Portlets plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Keyboard Shortcuts plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the jql.function.plugin.name plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the JIRA Footer plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Issue Views plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'
Make the Custom Field Types & Searchers plugin either 'System' or 'Bundled'

fields.description: When marking an item to be watched, it would be helpful to be able to enter some comments or reason that the items is being marked for a watch (i.e., critical client item, target date, performance item, etc).
fields.summary: Add a Watch Reason field to the Watch feature

fields.description:
Hello Support Team,

it would be very helpful for me, if you could give me a bit more Information about "indexing" and re-indexing in Jira Version 4.0.2.

I've read a lot of pages in the internet regarding this, but I can not found a solution to handle re-indexing as a service.

My questions are:

1. Is there a default for re-indexing or not?
2. Which steps are to do, to setup a re-indexing as a service if there is no default?

Many thanks for your support
fields.summary: More Information about Re-Indexing
AttachScreenshot applet - when you cancel the dialog, you end up with empty screenshot-redirecter.jsp popup

fields.description:
Hello,

I have a suggestion for an improvement to the Created vs Resolved Chart.
Currently you only can set how many previous days should be displayed on the chart. If the project (displayed on the chart) keeps going on you have to change the number of days over and over again to display full set of issues.

My suggestion is to add an alternative way to set the period displayed on the chart: if only one could set the start date (fixed date) from which the chart should start displaying issues and the end of this period should automatically change to the current date. In this way the chart will be always up to date without any need of user intervention.

I think it would be a major improvement to the functionality of this chart.
fields.summary: Created vs Resolved - fixed start date

Also 'webfragments.user.profile.panels.plugin.name'

Automatically include attachment link in attachment comment

fields.description:
Hi,

With regards to the excel export, I notice that when you export the navigator, the columns appear in a different configuration than in the GUI.

Daniel
fields.summary: Export the navigator to excel, the columns appear in a differnet configuration than in the GUI.
JQL: add the ability to query for the groups an user is member of
"In-Reply-Header" missing if one is not recipient of "issue created" email.

fields.description:
Add a 'Multi User Picker' custom field, and a 'Date Time' field below it.
Now create an issue, and add a user using the autocomplete feature of the Multi User Picker.
Then try to set the 'Date Time' field below it using the popup date picker.
The user field will appear above the date picker.

The div surrounding the user field textarea gets a z-index of 9000 when the autocomplete appears, but the z-index is never removed/reset after - causing it to appear above the date picker.
fields.summary: Multi User Picker remains with a z-index of 9000 after autocomplete.

fields.description:
Is there a magic way to graph bugs like this?

Total 
Open
Opened
Closed
Trend.

I'm having some problems using the default. Firstly I cant join several jira projects and thus get an overall view and I can't get enough status in the pie charts.

I'm hoping to make something like this, either like this or a pie chart

Possible?
fields.summary: history graph

fields.description:
This would be a really handy feature as I wish to log work against issues for "development" time, "installation" time, "discussions/meetings" etc.

This feature would need a user configurable list of items that can be chosen when logging against an issue.
fields.summary: When adding work-log entries can we have the ability to specify a "type" of work logged
License invalid when system uses the Buddhist calendar

fields.description:
Steps:
1. If customer has a missing entry for "elevatedsecurityguard" in seraph-config.xml, they will get a not so visible message in log file.
2. But if user go to "Administration" tab and try to enable "CAPTCHA", they can do it without any error message.

Result:
1. The functionality is superficially enabled and its not working in realty. The functionality is dependent on having following setting in seraph-config.xml file. If due to any reason the setting is missing, user will not get any error message while changing the CAPTCHA setting in Administration->General Configuration.

{noformat}
<elevatedsecurityguard class="com.atlassian.jira.security.login.JiraElevatedSecurityGuard"/>
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA CAPTCHA functionality will not work if seraph-config.xml is missing "elevatedsecurityguard" settings

fields.description:
The idea is to create a record of who is working in a project and who isn't. Users that are members of group "X" are active in the project, while the ones that are not members, have the same permissions, but are not actively working. It would allow the users to define if they are active or not.

It is not about permissions, but about status of the user.
fields.summary: Allow users to add/remove themselves from groups
Cascading Select field should have both parent and child value validated in the 'required' mode

fields.description:
Hi,

Could you please help me in providing the solution over the conditional auto creation of subtasks?

When I create the issue; sub-task should automatically get created. I think it is possible through workflow transtion or so.. 
It would be highly appreciated if you can provide me the steps to do so.

Thanks in advance.
Amit
fields.summary: auto creation of subtasks

fields.description: I would like to be able to use values from the parent of a ticket in subtasks in a read-only fashion for display, find, and sort order.  Something like parent.fixVersion or parent.priority would help us immensely.
fields.summary: Allow sorting actions based on parent's properites

fields.description:
I think JIRA could do with some more high-level options to cut out various UI steps relating to creating issues eg:

1) Add "Create issue in this version" links in each version shown in the Roadmap view, and any other views that list the project's versions.

2) Add "Create issue linked to this" links to the issue display page, so you can be prompted for the type of the link and create a new issue linked to the one you are currently viewing, all in one go.
fields.summary: Add context-sensitive "Create issue" links to UI

fields.description: When granting the _Browse Project_ permission for the current assignee: give ability to view project information (by going to _Projects > View All Projects_ and clicking a project name) only to users who are assignees in existing issues of that project. Users who are not assignees of issues in the project should not know about the existence of the project and who is its project lead.
fields.summary: Give ability to view project information only to users who are assignees in existing issues of the project

fields.description:
This bug has already being scheduled to be fixed in JIRA 4.2, so this is just for the record.

As far as the investigation goes, this problem only occurs in JIRA EAR/WAR installation type and using JDK 1.5+. 

Here are the steps to reproduce the problem:
- Download JIRA 4.1 war.
- Install and configure.
- Attempt to run.
- First attempt at resolving the default splash page results in exceptions thrown.

The following stack trace is thrown:
{noformat}
...
org.apache.jasper.JasperException: Unable to compile class for JSP

An error occurred at line: 29 in the jsp file: /includes/decorators/header.jsp
Generated servlet error:
Type mismatch: cannot convert from Object to KeyboardShortcutManager

at org.apache.jasper.compiler.DefaultErrorHandler.javacError(DefaultErrorHandler.java:84)
at org.apache.jasper.compiler.ErrorDispatcher.javacError(ErrorDispatcher.java:328)
at org.apache.jasper.compiler.JDTCompiler.generateClass(JDTCompiler.java:414)
at org.apache.jasper.compiler.Compiler.compile(Compiler.java:297)
...
{noformat}

It seems that there is a fundamental issue with the JSP code itself when being used with JDK 1.5+. The affected file is {{header.jsp}} file which is located in <JIRA_install>/atlassian-jira/includes/decorators/ directory:
*Original:*
{noformat}
...
...
WebResourceManager webResourceManager = ComponentManager.getInstance().getWebResourceManager();
    final KeyboardShortcutManager shortcutManager = ComponentManager.getComponentInstanceOfType(KeyboardShortcutManager.class);
...
{noformat}

*Fixed:*
{noformat}
...
WebResourceManager webResourceManager = ComponentManager.getInstance().getWebResourceManager();
final KeyboardShortcutManager shortcutManager = (KeyboardShortcutManager) ComponentManager.getComponentInstanceOfType(KeyboardShortcutManager.class);
...
{noformat}

There needs to be an explicit cast made to {{KeyboardShortcutManager}}.

Cheers.
fields.summary: Type mismatch: cannot convert from Object to KeyboardShortcutManager

fields.description:
*STEPS*
1. Add custom field with "version picker" type (for ex. with name Pass versio/s)
2. Add post function for operation (for ex. with name Pass) "Copy Value From Other Field" in workflow:
Source Field:  Fix Version/s
Destination Field:  Pass versio/s  
3. Activate this workflow
4. Initiate operation (Pass) for request
*EXPECT*
A new value added to "Pass version/s"list
*REAL*
message
Unable to copy value from 'Fix version/s' to 'Pass version/s'


I understand, that  "copy value from othr field" is incorrect operetion in my situation. 
Please, give me a recomendation, how to resolve this task.
fields.summary: Workflow: Post function: Unable to copy value from 'Fix version/s' to other version type field

fields.description:
I just started using this version of Jira, and I quite like the idea of the form token.  However, the feature is very frustrating because the form token is continually lost, even after just a few seconds.

I ran into this problem first after I left Jira up in my browser for some time.  Then I logged out and logged back in hoping that it would solve the problem.  It would work to enter a couple of issues, then I could edit one and it would say I lost the token again.  And this is almost immediately after saving the last issue.

I don't know if this is Chrome-specific, but I have a very generic browser configuration, so it's nothing special with cookies not being allowed, etc.
fields.summary: The form token is getting lost after just a few seconds

fields.description:
When performing issue move operations the attachment thumbnails in the data directory are not moved across properly.
Tested with both the standard *Move* workflow operation on the View Issue screen and *Bulk Move* through the Issue Navigator.

- Single move:
-- attachments *moved* across to new project issue
-- thumbnails *copied* across to new project issue, leaving original copy behind in old project issue
- Bulk move:
-- attachments *moved* across to new project issue
-- thumbnails *not copied* across to new project issue, leaving original copy behind in old project issue
fields.summary: Single and Bulk issue moves do not move attachment thumbnails properly

fields.description:
I work on a central team. We have several components that we use to separate all the teams we support. We also have created a template dashboard that we'd like to be able to duplicate for each of our teams, but there currently is no easy way to do this. Instead, we have to edit each and every filter used in the dashboard to use the correct Component.

If I could create a dashboard that used the layout/gadgets of a template dashboard, and just add layers of filters to everything in the dashboard, this would be incredibly awesome! And it would make my life much easier.

The same could be said for FixVersions - just have one template dashboard showing all the info you want, then you can easily make new FixVersion-specific dashboards for all your FixVersions. Imagine!
fields.summary: Dashboards should be able to add layers of Filters on top of a template dashboard
Allow exact-text searching in JQL
Plugin resource URLs not always valid
Escape key can not lose the contents of the comment box.

fields.description:
In issues which have custom fields that are date fields: do not keep data in those fields while cloning.

h4. Workaround
You can clear _change closure status_ field after clone action via a post function.

Steps to do this, you will need *Jira Suite Utilities* plugin:
# Edit the workflow.
# Click on the first step in the workflow.
# In the "Workflow Browser" section click "Create Issue"/"Create" transition.
# Add a post function to "Clear Field Value" for each field you don't want to clone.
# Publish the workflow.

When you do a Clone it will fire the "Create Issue"/"Create" transition on the cloned issue and run the new post functions clearing them out. 
Note: The field is also cleared when a new issue is created.
fields.summary: Do not keep data from custom date fields when cloning

fields.description:
We have a requirement to set a custom field when a transition occurs. The "post function" seems to be designed for this doesn't support custom fields.

See https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-51607.
fields.summary: Provide post function that sets values in custom fields as well as builtin fields.
Cannot index Customfield Datepicker with date < 1970

fields.description:
Hello, 

 We have recently upgraded from 4.0.1 to 4.1.1. However, We surprisingly came accross that the issue screen has been changed irreversibly. As we have searched in the forums, There is no backward compatibility. Since we are using Jira enterprise-wide, major changes affect employees. Upon this, we needed to downgrade. We have run this version for about 1 to 2 hours. There have been work of employees on the new version of jira. Even though we had backups of the old version, we did not want to lose the activities since the upgrade. However, it is not possible to downgrade with the database (data) of jira 4.1.1 to Jira 4.0.1. Because there is a version check. I have checked whether there is a major database structure change, fortunately, not. I edited the propertystring table to make db and application compitable with eachother. I eventually managed to run old version of jira with new version of db (without losing the works of employees).

I want to inform Atlassian that these kind of changes should not be made instantly. Now, we are in desicion not to use 4.1.1 for such a long time since the cost of coping with complaints is much more than compared to using old version. We try to look at major changes between versions, but we usually get lost on the documentation pages. We want to get informed kindly if there is any chance to use "old version" of issue screen with new version of jira 4.1.1. One further suggession, you should use warning mechanism, in previous versions, which informs customers that there will be changes in some of features in next releases. For example, you should be warning about the issue screen change starting from version 4.0. Again, you may offer that "Please use a test environment, install new version there, use it, like it, then upgrade". However, as I mentioned above by saying "irreversibly" , at least you should leave, as one of the forum commenters said, a legacy theme and let the customer decide whether to use new theme or not.
fields.summary: Jira 4.1.1 issue screen change
Clicking "more actions" dropdown then "comment" in the ops bar on "view issue" causes a gap to form ops bar and the rest of the issue

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Unzip JIRA and run "Startup.sh" file.
2. View the app in browser.

Result:
1. User is at setup screen.
2. The user is not getting the list of languages to choose from.
fields.summary: Setup page is having an empty "Choose language" list
Active Directory: Support for DNS SRV records to locate an AD/LDAP server (_ldap._tcp.)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21359].
  {panel}

CAPTCHA should be pluggable in JIRA

[CAPTCHA|http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/CAPTCHA] is supposed to stop spam and other automated nefarious usage of systems.

But there is an arms race of [CAPTCHA breaking|http://www.slightlyshadyseo.com/index.php/xmcps-how-tobasic-captcha-cracking-techniques-part-1/] and then coming up with [new and better CAPTCHA solutions|http://blog.chromosundrift.com/2009/04/google-whats-up-captcha.html].

IN addition, like many others, JIRA's current CAPTCHA can be difficult for humans to read, see JRA-16559 .

So if JIRA had a pluggable CAPTCHA capability, it would be possible for JIRA to more quickly benefit from available advances in CAPTCHA protection without a change to the core product.

_(Oswaldo implemented this in shipit day)_
fields.summary: Pluggable CAPTCHA

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-21358].
  {panel}

Enable password strength rules to 

# tell the user the effective strength of the password they choose
# optionally allow administrators to restrict the minimum strength of passwords chosen by users
# be pluggable

Currently you can enforce password strength by using JIRA with Crowd
fields.summary: Password strength measurement and restriction

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Login to JIRA.
2. Add "Voted Issue" gadget to the dashboard.
3. The gadget with default configuration show all the voted unresolved issues.
4. Now click "Matching Issues" link to view the issues in issue navigator.

Result:
1. User sees all issue(unresolved+ resolved).


Expected:
1. User should be shown only unresolved issue, if "Show resolved issue" checkbox is uncheck.
fields.summary: Clicking on "Matching Issues" for vote gadget always show total votes issue irrespective whether user has click " Show the total votes per issue" checkbox or not

fields.description:
After the work in JRA-21322 (which was a result of JRA-21005 that enabled httpOnly cookies in standalone JIRA) I noticed a problem with IE6:

For some reason the IE6 session is getting stomped on by tomcat. In practice this means

1) If you have "Remember Me" checked then the user doesn't notice anything.
2) If you don't have "Remember Me" checked then the screenshot gets attached properly but when you are redirected to the Manage Attachments page you get logged out.
fields.summary: Redirect after screenshot stomps session in IE6 (only noticeable if you don't have Remember Me checked)

fields.description:
Scenario: a Jira server hosts multiple projects, with different users having access to different projects. Some projects are public, some are not.

I would like to be able to create projects that are public, but not visible to all users unless they specifically request it.

The specific situation I want to support is where a project is not yet completely public but is going into beta testing. I'll recruit beta testers from outside my organization and I want to be able to give them a URL where they can go to 'sign up for the beta'. The landing page would let them create an account and simultaneously add them to a security group ('Project XYZ Beta Testers') which would then give them access to the project. This would be on a per-project basis, so they's only get added to the specific project and only if that project is configured to accept auto-enrollment.

Alternatively, upon creating a new user account, the user could be presented with a list of projects, they tick the ones they want access to and then they are either added automatically, or the project manager is emailed a notification to add the user to the project.
fields.summary: Allow users to sign up and request access to a project

fields.description:
My team uses the "issues in progress" configuration on their dashboard in order to track tasks they need to work on.  

Project Management also uses it to snapshot what work the team is currently pursuing.

We would like to see if there is a way to change the status of an item to "in progress" when work is logged.  

I see this as a check-box on the work-logged page, or a possible workflow.

We'd also like to see if this can support the workflow condition (when this condition is enabled) where a user must be the "assignee" in order to start progress by auto-assigning the issue to the user logging the work.
fields.summary: Change issue status to "In Progress" after work is logged

fields.description:
An issue with a Description which exceeds one printer page does not print correctly -- the Description is truncated at the end of a page and the next page continues with the Attachments.

I have seen this with two issues.  This one is publicaly accessible:
http://track.sipfoundry.org/browse/XX-8427

I used the browser Print function and printed to a Postscript file, which is attached as AA.ps.  When this file is printed, the Description starts page 2, but the bottom end of the Description is truncated, and page 3 starts with Attachments.  This can be seen easily by comparing AA.ps with the web version of the issue.  (When I print the issue directly, I see the same format error, though of course, I can't attach that!)

A window dump of the browser displaying the bottom part of the Description and the Attachment is attached as 14.04.32c.jpeg.

The browser identifies itself as:
Mozilla/5.0 (X11; U; Linux i686; en-US; rv:1.9.0.15) Gecko/2009102704 Fedora/3.0.15-1.fc10 Firefox/3.0.15

This is seen in Jira v4.1#519.
fields.summary: An issue with a long Description does not print correctly
Unable to find resource for plugin: resources and path: com.atlassian.gadgets.dashboard:dashboard/images/icons/tools_20.png & css/images/menu_indicator_for_light_backgrounds.gif

fields.description:
John Price reported this issue when creating an Issue tab plugin that uses an iframe in JIRA 4.1:

{quote}I have an issue tab panel plugin that displays an iframe with content from our company web site, In my test upgrade to 4.1, it causes "Permission Denied" javascript errors to pop up when the panel is clicked. This is in IE only (version 8). It worked fine in JIRA 4.0, and it also works fine in FF with JIRA 4.1.

When debugging, the error is coming from a file called ajs.js, which must be part of the JIRA installation.{quote}

I've been able to validate this on a local test system.  In JIRA 4.0, there are no errors in IE8.  In JIRA 4.1, the Javascript error appears.  This is using the same plugin JAR file.

John has also been kind enough to provide a simple test Issue tab plugin that attempts to display Wikipedia in an iframe, which I have attached to this issue.  To reproduce:
{quote}Here are the steps to reproduce:
* install the plugin in JIRA 4.1. It shows up as "iFrame Test" in admin.
* open JIRA in Internet Explorer 8.
* Go to any issue and click the "iFrame Tab Panel" tab.
* You should get a javascript error.{quote}

John initially created [this|http://forums.atlassian.com/thread.jspa?messageID=257341600&tstart=0] forum post to resolve his issue but received no responses.
fields.summary: JIRA 4.1 Breaks Custom Plugin That Uses an iframe
Save selected dashboard between logon sessions

fields.description:
Modify JIRA so that clicking "create" button is the only way to complete the create issue operation.

Reason: when you fill in mandatory fields and pushes return (enter) key accidentally, the issue will be created; this can be a problem for users who have no permission to edit issues, since there is no way for them to correct mistakes they made in the create issue screen.
fields.summary: Only create an issue when clicking the "Create" button

fields.description:
When performing a search and ordering by {{Affected Version}}, in some occasions the order is wrong.

I could reproduce the bug:
!error.png!

I found some related errors about ordering version fields for older JIRA applications. But they were already set as fixed.

I think it's a new bug related to JQL.

For the error above, I used the following JQL
{code}
project = ITPP AND issuetype = Bug AND priority IN (A1, A2, A3) AND status in (New, "In Progress", Reopened, Resolved, Verified, Confirmed, Committed) ORDER BY affectedVersion ASC, key DESC
{code}
and
{code}
project = ITPP AND issuetype = Bug AND priority IN (A1, A2, A3) AND status in (New, "In Progress", Reopened, Resolved, Verified, Confirmed, Committed) ORDER BY affectedVersion
{code}

Both queries resulted the same.
fields.summary: Search and sort by AffectedVersion are not correctly

fields.description:
The German (Germany) translation for JIRA Mode are:
* Öffentlich & 
* Keine

But the explanation under the field stated:
1. Öffentlich - Alle Benutzer können sich anmelden und Vorgänge erstellen.
2. Privat - Nur Administratoren können neue Benutzer erstellen. 

Privat should be used instead of Keine in the Select List.

If it's possible please revert it to filename.l as handling two different names for the field is not trivial on our side. Also keeping the new name will probably break ALM Works JIRA Client. Also please check other fields on the form too.

fields.description:
The [Jira Suite Utilities|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/5048] page states that it is a type *TWO* plugin in the *Plugin Details* section, when it's *Version 0.7.3* .jar file is of type *ONE*.
The [Installation Guide|http://code.google.com/p/jira-suite-utilities/wiki/InstallationGuide] also verifies its installation location as *WEB-INF/lib*.
fields.summary: Jira Suite Utilities page should state it is a Plugin 1 plugin

fields.description:
The [JIRA Calendar Plugin|https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/293] page states that it is a type *ONE* plugin in the *Plugin Details* section, when it's *Version 1.13* .jar file is of type *TWO*.
Although the [Documentation|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JCAL/JIRA+Calendar+Plugin] indicates to install it into *WEB-INF/lib* if it's downloaded as a .zip file, the [main download link|https://plugins.atlassian.com/server/1.0/download/pluginVersion/21654] provides the .jar file which is to be installed into *_<jira.home>_/plugins/installed-plugins*.
fields.summary: JIRA Calendar Plugin page should state it is a Plugin 2 plugin

fields.description: We need to have JIRA users access subversion repository. JIRA admin need to be able to create and manage subversion users/permission within JIRA. Just like CollabNet Team Forge
fields.summary: User Manager for Subversion

fields.description:
I was just in the forums and came across [this post|http://forums.atlassian.com/message.jspa?messageID=257342285#257342285] regarding the JIRA Charting plug-in and the Workload Pie Chart report which does not come bundled with JIRA 4.0. 

I think the docs for JIRA 4.0 need to be updated to say this is the case. It can just be added to the list and the wording changed to say "the following charts do not come bundled with 4.0", instead of "the following three charts do not come bundled". That's not the exacting wording, but basically removing the reference to three charts and have it be more generic seems like it may be helpful. I'm not sure if there are other charts that are missing, but if there are then we wouldn't need to keep updating the doc if additional charts are found to be missing. 

I would have made the changes myself, but there are some restrictions on the page and I can't. Hope this helps, let me know if there are any questions.

Cheers,


Adam G. Saint-Prix
Workflow Developer, eCommerce Collaboration & Workflow Tools
Worldwide eCommerce Organization
Symantec Corporation
www.symantecstore.com
fields.summary: update JIRA 4.0 upgrade guide re: Charting Plugin and Workload Pie Chart

fields.description:
JIRA is in Russian GUI.
I am deleting *Intro* gadget, *Введение* in Russian.
Confirmation dialog shows HTML codes instead of Cyrillic letters.
See screenshot.
fields.summary: HTML codes in prompt message instead Cyrillic letters

fields.description:
In 4.1.1, the ability to reorder transition steps was added, per JRA-5789.  The method to do so is to add a property to each step called "opsbar-sequence" - the integer values of this property define the order in which the steps will appear.

While this DOES work, it definitely seems like the "cheap way" out, and is not easy to use.  The workflow editor does not display items in this order, so from here you have no idea if the order is correct.  Only (?) by publishing and going to an issue in the appropriate step can you confirm the ordering.

It would be MUCH more usable to either have a "drag-and-drop" (as was mentioned in the other issue after it was released), or maybe even simply some "up and down" arrows that allow me to reorder the steps.  A button to sort the list alphabetically (or reverse alphabetically) would probably also be useful for some users.

Why should I care what some arbitrary integer value is of the step after the one I'm interested?  To the user, that does not matter and gets complicated very quickly - especially if there are a decent number of transition steps involved.  What matters is that I want step A to appear after step B - that's all.  If JIRA wants to assign arbitrary integers based on how I order them in the UI, so be it.  But that is an internal implementation detail, not something to be exposed to the user.
fields.summary: Improvement to transition ordering introduced in 4.1

fields.description:

Thanks

2010-05-17 10:59:11,786 http-8080-7 ERROR admin 659x435x1 eaxyxo 172.20.3.70 /secure/AttachFile.jspa
 [jira.security.xsrf.XsrfErrorAction] The security token is missing for 'admin'. 
User-Agent : 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 5.2; en-GB; rv:1.9.2.2) Gecko/20100316 Firefox/3.6.2 (.NET CLR 3.5.30729)'
{noformat}

The same operation works in JIRA 4.1.1 (testing on JAC).

fields.description:
In JRA-20620, code was added such as when you collapse a shortened field (such as Affects Version or Fix Version), the viewport scrolls back so that the field is visible.

However, in IE, the viewport is now also moved when the field is *expanded*, even though the field is already visible on the screen.

That is, starting from this:

!Expand1-Before.png!

In IE but not FireFox, if you click the expand icon, the user sees this:

!Expand2-After.png!
